articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Syrians awakened on Monday to a hopeful if uncertain future, after rebels seized the capital Damascus and President Bashar al-Assad fled to Russia, ending a 13-year civil war and more than 50 years of his family's brutal rule.
articles.title: With Assad ousted, a new era starts in Syria as the  world watches

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: The commander of South Korea's special forces that stormed parliament last week after a martial law declaration said on Monday he was ordered to block lawmakers from entering the chamber to prevent a vote to lift the emergency measure.
articles.title: South Korea special forces officer says he had orders to block lawmakers

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan raised its alert level on Monday saying China has set up seven zones of reserved airspace and deployed naval fleets and coast guard boats in what a security source described as the first military drills across a broad swathe of the region's waters.
articles.title: Taiwan raises alert as China deploys 90 ships in likely drills

articles.author: Yurii Kovalenko, Valentyn Ogirenko
articles.description: When Ukrainian judge Vladyslav Tsukurov learned he could serve his country with both gavel and gun, he jumped at the chance.
articles.title: Ukraine's drone-hunting judges fight on two fronts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran has opened a direct line of communication with rebels in Syria's new leadership since its ally Bashar al-Assad was ousted, a senior Iranian official told Reuters on Monday, in an attempt to "prevent a hostile trajectory" between the countries.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran in direct contact with groups in new Syrian leadership, Iranian official says

articles.author: Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Germany's conservative opposition leader Friedrich Merz, who is in pole position to become the country's next chancellor, arrived in Kyiv on Monday to pledge his support for the Ukrainian leadership in the war with Russia.
articles.title: German opposition chief Merz visits Ukraine as war dominates election campaign

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five soldiers were killed and another was critically injured in a military helicopter crash in southwest Turkey on Monday, the defence ministry said.
articles.title: Five killed in military helicopter crash in southwest Turkey

articles.author: Maxwell Adombila, Bate Felix
articles.description: John Dramani Mahama, who is returning as Ghana's president eight years after losing power, achieved his political comeback on a promise to mend the West African country's economy.
articles.title: John Dramani Mahama returning as Ghana president on pledge to mend economy

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinian health officials said on Sunday that Israeli forces had shelled the Kamal Adwan Hospital in the northern Gaza town of Beit Lahiya, damaging electricity and oxygen pumps and disrupting urgent surgeries.
articles.title: Israel shells north Gaza hospital, disrupting service, doctors say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A mystery disease in the Democratic Republic of Congo is spreading mainly among children and putting severely malnourished people at risk, according to the World Health Organization, which sent experts to the region to investigate the outbreak.
articles.title: Undiagnosed disease in Congo puts children, malnourished at risk, WHO says
